content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a function in Julia that can be used to achieve this:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = split(md, "\n```julia")
    code_blocks = [split(block, "```\n")[1] for block in blocks if length(block) > 2]
    return join([strip(block, [' ', '\t']) for block in code_blocks], "\n")
end
```

This function works by first splitting the input markdown string into separate blocks based on the presence of a Julia code fence (````julia`) and then further splitting each block into its constituent parts. The first part (up to but not including ````\n`) is the actual code block, which we extract and join together with newline characters.

Please note that this function assumes that there are no indented lines in your Julia code blocks, as it strips out all leading whitespace before joining the blocks together. If your code contains indentation (or other types of formatting), you may need to adjust this function accordingly.
